column4: hi i am trying to mount a windows share with the following command, "sudo smbmount //192.168.1.3/Storage/ /home/jody/Downloads/smb/ -o username=joe,password=password,rw". it mounts perfectly, but i can not write to it. any ideas? thanks
it works fine if I log in as root on the ubuntu machine
do u want to see the output?
It is because you mounted as root. unmount it and remount without sudo
I tried to that directory also but with no luck
is downoads/smb properly unmounted. I need to see the exact command and output pastes
Can you paste the exact command aswell please
Just here is fine for one line
thanks a million it works perfectly
If it is a regular mount. It would be better to add to fstab with same options
will do. again, thank you very much
